basics.name: Nick Peihl
basics.label: Geospatial and Web Solutions Engineer
basics.summary: Rarely content with out-of-the-box products, Nick has been building custom solutions to geospatial problems since 2005. Early in his career he saved his organization thousands of dollars in license fees by migrating an enterprise geodatabase from SQL Server to PostgreSQL. Irritated by performing reptitive tasks, Nick quickly learned and started writing Python scripts to increase his productivity, saving hundreds of man hours. By 2009, Nick was creating secure web applications using Django to allow consultants to directly access and edit databases. Today, Nick focuses on creating performant and accessible web applications using modular JavaScript and Node.js. When not working or obsessively starring inspiring projects on GitHub, Nick enjoys dancing ballet and walking his two rescued greyhounds.

highlights: Core contributor to the DropChop open source project which proves you don't need a server to do geospatial analysis
Presentation on open source options for offline custom maps for mobile devices
volunteer.summary: CUGOS provides support and ideas for users of open source geospatial software through monthly meetings, annual conferences and project sidecars.
volunteer.organization: Cascadia Users of Geospatial Open Source (CUGOS)

highlights: Building fast and responsive geospatial web applications for residents with offline-first strategies using service workers, IndexedDB, and P2P technologies
Created Footprint Review - a crowdsourcing web application for conflating GIS data
Re-negotiated aerial photography contract to provide higher resolution imagery at no additional cost
Supervision of all GIS department projects and staff
Assigned role of backup IT Manager for supervision of staff and critical decision-making
work.summary: San Juan County is an archipelago of small islands off the coast of Washington state. The San Juan islands are a very popular tourist destination but otherwise sparsely populated.

highlights: Designed and maintained an enterprise geodatabases running on Microsoft SQL Server and PostgreSQL/PostGIS with links between geographic data and a Laserfiche document management system
Conducted spatial analyses to determine where and how proposed infrastructure or developments affect protected species habitats and natural communities
Designed annual reports showing habitat conservation progress using spatial SQL queries
Used Django framework to develop data entry web applications for consultants as an alternative to emailing Excel spreadsheets back and forth
work.summary: The Coachella Valley Association of Governments (CVAG) is a municipal transportation and community planning agency with nine member cities and four Indian reservations. CVAG was instrumental in creating and maintaining the Coachella Valley Multiple Species Habitat Conservation Plan (CVMSHCP). The CVMSHCP is a 1.1 million acre plan to protect 27 species habitats and 27 natural communities.
